adjectives.description: airtight (comparative more airtight, superlative most airtight)

entries.meaning: Impermeable to air or other gases.
(figuratively) Having no weak points or flaws.
examples: We have an airtight argument they won’t be able to punch holes in.

entries.meaning: (figuratively, of a person) Highly reserved in some matter, particularly tight-lipped or tight-fisted.
examples: when Roger asked for $100 to take the preliminary steps to establish his claim, Mike yelled like a Hebrew auctioneer, for he was air-tight and squeezed a dollar until the woman on it yelled.
